GlobalVariables.StudyDescription: This file contains the metadata, events, and data for REDCap project "API Allowlist EM Rules".

redcap:Surveys.title: API Allowlist Request
redcap:Surveys.response_limit_custom_text: Thank you for your interest; however, the survey is closed because the maximum number of responses has been reached.

Question.TranslatedText: Rule ID

API Allowlist Rules Project This is a template survey that you can use for end-users to request new allowlist rules (or firewall exemptions, depending on your language). Feel free to customize this project so long as you leave the following field untouched from the second instrument: 'rule_id', 'username', 'project_id', 'ip_address', 'inactive'
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
API Allowlist Rules Project

This is a template survey that you can use for end-users to request new allowlist rules (or firewall exemptions, depending on your language). Feel free to customize this project so long as you leave the following field untouched from the second instrument: < code>'rule_id', 'username', 'project_id', 'ip_address', 'inactive'< /code>

Question.TranslatedText: First name
Last name
Department
Title / Affiliation

ItemDef.Name: user_id
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: This is the name of the user who has the API token on the project

Question.TranslatedText: User ID

ItemDef.Name: email
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: So we can notify you when we are done

Question.TranslatedText: Email
Please describe your REDCap project(s) and why you think you need an API exception:

ItemDef.Name: request_pid
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: This can be found from the URL when inside your project as pid=xxxxxx

Question.TranslatedText: Please enter the REDCap Project ID(s). If more than one provide a comma-separated list
Does your project contain PHI?
Please describe why this request is necessary:
Please describe why this request is necessary:
Please describe why this request is necessary:
Please describe why this request is necessary:
Please describe other reason:
Please explain why it is not possible to first make a VPN connection prior to using the API?
Please describe your application type
Please describe your application type
Please describe your application type

Please note that an API token is like your username and password and should be treated as such. If you ever feel your API token has been compromised you can reset it on your project in a single click.
You should NEVER commit your API token to a version control system (GIT, Subversion).
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Please select the kind of device(s) that will be connecting to the API
Will any other users have access to your API token?
Please describe how you are securing your API token on the device(s) that will be using it?
Please set a date when this exception should expire (typically the scheduled lifetime of the project)
Please describe how the device(s) will be connecting to the internet when contacting the API:
Please describe how the device(s) will be connecting to the internet when contacting the API:
Please describe how the device(s) will be connecting to the internet when contacting the API:
Please enter the server's public IP address

Please describe the area/building where the devices are connected to the internet. If possible, provide the name of an IT contact and phone number so we could obtain a range of IP addresses the site uses.

I understand that an API token is the SAME as my username and password in plain text format. Anyone that has access to this credential could obtain access to the data contained in the corresponding REDCap project.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText: I understand that an API token is the SAME as my username and password in plain text format. Anyone that has access to this credential could obtain access to the data contained in the corresponding REDCap project.

Question.TranslatedText: Please sign your request:
Complete?

REQUEST SUMMARY
NAME: [name_first] [name_last] [user_id] [department] [title_affiliation] [email]
PID: [request_pid] PHI: [request_phi] REQUEST: [request_reason] [reason_other]
VPN: [request_vpn_exception]
TYPE: [request_type]
DEVICE: [request_devices]
API SECURITY: [request_token_users] [request_token_security]
IP: [request_ip_ranges] [request_ip_server] [request_ip_range_contact]
EXPIRATION: [request_expiration]
ATTESTATION: [api_token_attestation]
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
REQUEST SUMMARY
NAME: [name_first] [name_last] [user_id] [department] [title_affiliation] [email] PID: [request_pid] PHI: [request_phi] REQUEST: [request_reason] [reason_other] VPN: [request_vpn_exception] TYPE: [request_type] DEVICE: [request_devices] API SECURITY: [request_token_users] [request_token_security] IP: [request_ip_ranges] [request_ip_server] [request_ip_range_contact] EXPIRATION: [request_expiration] ATTESTATION: [api_token_attestation]

ItemDef.Name: allowlist_type___1
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: A allowlist rule is only valid if all configured filters are true. So, the more specific you are, the more limiting your filter is.

Question.TranslatedText: Allowlist Options If you make a filter that only operates on IP, then regardless of user and project a valid IP will be allowed. Conversely, if you specify IP, User, and Project, then requests will have to match all three filters to be allowed.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Allowlist Options
If you make a filter that only operates on IP, then regardless of user and project a valid IP will be allowed. Conversely, if you specify IP, User, and Project, then requests will have to match all three filters to be allowed.

ItemDef.Name: allowlist_type___2
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: A allowlist rule is only valid if all configured filters are true. So, the more specific you are, the more limiting your filter is.

Question.TranslatedText: Allowlist Options If you make a filter that only operates on IP, then regardless of user and project a valid IP will be allowed. Conversely, if you specify IP, User, and Project, then requests will have to match all three filters to be allowed.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Allowlist Options
If you make a filter that only operates on IP, then regardless of user and project a valid IP will be allowed. Conversely, if you specify IP, User, and Project, then requests will have to match all three filters to be allowed.

ItemDef.Name: allowlist_type___3
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: A allowlist rule is only valid if all configured filters are true. So, the more specific you are, the more limiting your filter is.

Question.TranslatedText: Allowlist Options If you make a filter that only operates on IP, then regardless of user and project a valid IP will be allowed. Conversely, if you specify IP, User, and Project, then requests will have to match all three filters to be allowed.
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
Allowlist Options
If you make a filter that only operates on IP, then regardless of user and project a valid IP will be allowed. Conversely, if you specify IP, User, and Project, then requests will have to match all three filters to be allowed.

ItemDef.Name: ip_address
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote:
e.g. 192.168.0.1/24, 10.0.0.1
Calculator

Question.TranslatedText: IP Address(es) (CIDR Notation Supported) Enter 1 or more CIDR blocks separated by a comma or new-line
Question.redcap:FormattedTranslatedText:
IP Address(es) (CIDR Notation Supported)
Enter 1 or more CIDR blocks separated by a comma or new-line

Question.TranslatedText: Username
Project Id

ItemDef.Name: expiration_date
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: Rule will stop working after date if specified

ItemDef.Name: enabled___1
ItemDef.redcap:FieldNote: You must check to enable this rule

Question.TranslatedText: Complete?

CodeList.Name: request_reason___1
CodeList.redcap:CheckboxChoices: 1, Use of myCap|2, Use of Mobile App|3, Unable to use VPN prior to API access|99, Other

CodeList.Name: request_reason___99
CodeList.redcap:CheckboxChoices: 1, Use of myCap|2, Use of Mobile App|3, Unable to use VPN prior to API access|99, Other

CodeList.Name: request_type___1
CodeList.redcap:CheckboxChoices: 1, Exception for a single REDCap project and User. Select this if you are using non-stanford devices or might be roaming around the world (e.g. a study in a foreign country)|2, Exception for a new trusted ip/network range (e.g. a lab or clinic) . Select this if you have a Stanford-owned server that meets MINSEC and is kept in a secure location.|98, I'm not sure

CodeList.Name: request_ip_ranges___1
CodeList.redcap:CheckboxChoices: 1, Static IP Address (e.g. server)|2, Dynamic IP address inside of a building (a range that could be selected, e.g. an off-site clinic)|3, Dynamic IP address all around the world (e.g. Starbucks to personal Comcast internet)

CodeList.Name: request_ip_ranges___2
CodeList.redcap:CheckboxChoices: 1, Static IP Address (e.g. server)|2, Dynamic IP address inside of a building (a range that could be selected, e.g. an off-site clinic)|3, Dynamic IP address all around the world (e.g. Starbucks to personal Comcast internet)

CodeList.Name: allowlist_type___1
CodeList.redcap:CheckboxChoices: 1, IP (filter by ip/networks)|2, User (filter by username)|3, Project (filter by project id)
